newsitem.title: FRANCE: Bank of France drains 2.9 bln Ffr at tender.
newsitem.headline: Bank of France drains 2.9 bln Ffr at tender.

text.p: The Bank of France drained 2.9 billion francs at a securities repurchase tender held on Monday to allocate funds for injection into the money market on Tuesday.
It accepted bids for 35.1 billion francs in new liquidity, 2.9 billion less than the 38.0 billion leaving the market on Tuesday when a previous pact expires. The new pact expires on October 29.
The Bank of France said it allocated 10.6 billion francs to bidders offering Treasury bills as collateral, satisfying 2.9 percent of such demand.
It allotted a further 24.5 billion to bidders putting up private paper, satisfying 10.1 percent of this demand.
